poem:
"Beyond the Eyes of the Beholder"

In the mirrored halls of pageantry, 
two queens relinquish their thrones,
their beauty, not a sovereignty,
but rather a chattel, on loan. 
With cryptic words they disengage,
like swans breaking from a serene image,
To tell us, so gently, with a courage immense,
True radiance radiates not from opulence,
But from an inner stance.
